list_definition.definition: a person who makes plates, cups, vases etc out of clay and fires them in an oven (called a kiln)
to wander about doing small jobs or doing nothing important

list_ex_of_english: As an active par ticipant in the production process, she gained a rare inside view of the work and life of the potters.
We visited sources, talked to potters, and collected samples from potters and from sources.
Demand is not sufficient for peripheral potters to make a wide range of pots.
I would expect the potter to respect the sentimental value of the plate, but not to understand it.
The verse is clay, not marble, and it's the actor who turns the potter's wheel.
Two additional dimensions of potting have received attention in the archaeological literature and are expected to vary with the core -periphery economic position of potters.
The potters take advantage of the rainy season to sow maize and beans, which are harvested in the autumn.
It was the plan that all potters would eventually follow.
